page.title: 02BALDOCK
page.content: The town of Baldock has a population of about 7000 (1984). It forms part of a trio of North Hertfordshire towns, Hitchin, Letchworth, Baldock which forms an almost continous strip of urbanisation on the A505. Baldock has a very limited industrial base, there being a small industrial estate on the A505. Most of the inhabitants work in the adjacent towns and Stevenage. There is some commuting by train to London. The shopping patterns reflect the competition from larger towns, and many shop units are occupied by specialist shops or by services. A market is still held on Wednesdays, in the High Street but the cattle market has closed. The annual fair is held on Oct 2nd and 3rd, which now consists of a funfair in the High Street.
